questions.question: He is smarter than ...................
questions.description: You has the same subject and object form.

questions.question: He lives on ..................... own terms.
questions.description: We need a possessive adjective here hence we use his.

questions.question: The old woman is quite fond of .................... grandchildren.
questions.description: We need a possessive adjective here. The words your, my, our, his, her and their are possessive adjectives.

questions.question: Can you show me ..................... passport?
questions.description: We need a possessive adjective here. The words your, my, our, his, her and their are possessive adjectives.

questions.question: I know ................... and .................... parents.
questions.description: A pronoun used an object should be in its object form. Before a noun, we need a possessive adjective.

questions.question: This is my passport. Can you show me .........................?
questions.description: The words mine, his, hers, theirs, ours and yours are possessive pronouns. They are used alone.

questions.question: That purse is .........................
questions.description: The words mine, his, hers, theirs, ours and yours are possessive pronouns. They are used alone.

questions.question: That dog of ..................... is always barking at me.
questions.description: The words mine, his, hers, theirs, ours and yours are possessive pronouns. They are used alone.

questions.question: Whose bag is this? It is ......................
questions.description: The words mine, his, hers, theirs, ours and yours are possessive pronouns. They are used alone.

questions.question: When are you going to return the camera you borrowed from ………………………….?
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: Does she understand what .................... is doing?
questions.description: A pronoun used as a subject should be in its subject form.

questions.question: What she says or does makes no sense to ………………………….
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.
